title: How to Level Up Your Enchanting in Elder Scrolls Online

steps.headline: Gather runes from the world.
steps.description: Do this by walking outside of towns and looking for small triangular rocks aligned on the ground. You can walk up to them and grab the runes by hitting the A button next to the rune. If you get the “Keen Eye: Rune Stones” perk in the Enchanting skill tree, runes glow so that you can spot them easier.

steps.headline: Go to a major city and look for an Enchanting Table.
steps.description: Enchanting Tables can be found in any Mages Guild or right in town. They are tables with a purple glowing crystal on top as well as an open book and scattered gems.

steps.headline: Activate the table.
steps.description: When you find the table, walk up to it and hit the A button to go open its menu.

steps.headline: Open the Construction menu.
steps.description: Hit the A button over “Create” to get the Construction menu to come up, and you will see all of your runestones. Runestones come in three types: potency, essence, and aspect. Potency says what it does—for example, adds, deducts, and increases. Essence runestones decide what the potency is going to effect, such as health, fire, magika, and so on. Aspect runestones determine the final quality.

steps.headline: Select one runestone from each category.
steps.description: Try to pick something you need. You could make a superior Add Health rune for a piece of armor, for instance. When you pick the three types, look on the bottom right side of the screen to make sure they are correct.

steps.headline: Create the glyph.
steps.description: Hit the X button, and the ruins will be combined to make a glyph. Doing this action will give you the glyph and work towards leveling up your enchanting skill.

steps.headline: Create or find enough glyphs to make the trip to town worth your while.
steps.description: If you don’t want to create, you can find glyphs either in random containers in the wild, as boss drops when you clear an area, or in hidden treasure chests scattered throughout the map. A good recommended number of glyphs to have when you want to deconstruct is ten or so.

steps.headline: Find an Enchanting Table.
steps.description: You can find one at any Mages Guild or in any town. You will be able to recognize it by the fact that it is a table with a purple crystal on top, along with an open book.

steps.headline: Hit A on the Enchanting Table.
steps.description: A menu will pop up with two options.

steps.headline: Open the Deconstruction menu.
steps.description: The bottom option says “Deconstruction.” Go down to it, and press A again. A list of your glyphs will be displayed.

steps.headline: Select a glyph to deconstruct.
steps.description: Scroll through the list of glyphs and find the one that you want to deconstruct.

steps.headline: Deconstruct the glyph.
steps.description: When you find the one that you wish to deconstruct, hit the A button; this will break the glyph down. You will be notified if you managed to get any runestones from your deconstruction. You can get up to three runestones per deconstruction, and you will level up your enchanting.

text: Creating Glyphs Gather runes from the world. Do this by walking outside of towns and looking for small triangular rocks aligned on the ground. You can walk up to them and grab the runes by hitting the A button next to the rune. If you get the “Keen Eye: Rune Stones” perk in the Enchanting skill tree, runes glow so that you can spot them easier. Go to a major city and look for an Enchanting Table. Enchanting Tables can be found in any Mages Guild or right in town. They are tables with a purple glowing crystal on top as well as an open book and scattered gems. Activate the table. When you find the table, walk up to it and hit the A button to go open its menu. Open the Construction menu. Hit the A button over “Create” to get the Construction menu to come up, and you will see all of your runestones. Runestones come in three types: potency, essence, and aspect. Potency says what it does—for example, adds, deducts, and increases. Essence runestones decide what the potency is going to effect, such as health, fire, magika, and so on. Aspect runestones determine the final quality. Select one runestone from each category. Try to pick something you need. You could make a superior Add Health rune for a piece of armor, for instance. When you pick the three types, look on the bottom right side of the screen to make sure they are correct. Create the glyph. Hit the X button, and the ruins will be combined to make a glyph. Doing this action will give you the glyph and work towards leveling up your enchanting skill. Deconstructing Glyphs Create or find enough glyphs to make the trip to town worth your while. If you don’t want to create, you can find glyphs either in random containers in the wild, as boss drops when you clear an area, or in hidden treasure chests scattered throughout the map. A good recommended number of glyphs to have when you want to deconstruct is ten or so. Find an Enchanting Table. You can find one at any Mages Guild or in any town. You will be able to recognize it by the fact that it is a table with a purple crystal on top, along with an open book. Hit A on the Enchanting Table. A menu will pop up with two options. Open the Deconstruction menu. The bottom option says “Deconstruction.” Go down to it, and press A again. A list of your glyphs will be displayed. Select a glyph to deconstruct. Scroll through the list of glyphs and find the one that you want to deconstruct. Deconstruct the glyph. When you find the one that you wish to deconstruct, hit the A button; this will break the glyph down. You will be notified if you managed to get any runestones from your deconstruction. You can get up to three runestones per deconstruction, and you will level up your enchanting.
